58#ifndef __NetBSD__
59static int intel_fbdev_set_par(struct fb_info *info)
60{
61 struct drm_fb_helper *fb_helper = info->par;
62 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev =
63 container_of(fb_helper, struct intel_fbdev, helper);
64 int ret;
65
66 ret = drm_fb_helper_set_par(info);
67
68 if (ret == 0) {
69 mutex_lock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
70 intel_fb_obj_invalidate(ifbdev->fb->obj, ORIGIN_GTT);
71 mutex_unlock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
72 }
73
74 return ret;
75}
76
77static int intel_fbdev_blank(int blank, struct fb_info *info)
78{
79 struct drm_fb_helper *fb_helper = info->par;
80 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev =
81 container_of(fb_helper, struct intel_fbdev, helper);
82 int ret;
83
84 ret = drm_fb_helper_blank(blank, info);
85
86 if (ret == 0) {
87 mutex_lock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
88 intel_fb_obj_invalidate(ifbdev->fb->obj, ORIGIN_GTT);
89 mutex_unlock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
90 }
91
92 return ret;
93}
94
95static int intel_fbdev_pan_display(struct fb_var_screeninfo *var,
96 struct fb_info *info)
97{
98 struct drm_fb_helper *fb_helper = info->par;
99 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev =
100 container_of(fb_helper, struct intel_fbdev, helper);
101
102 int ret;
103 ret = drm_fb_helper_pan_display(var, info);
104
105 if (ret == 0) {
106 mutex_lock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
107 intel_fb_obj_invalidate(ifbdev->fb->obj, ORIGIN_GTT);
108 mutex_unlock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
109 }
110
111 return ret;
112}
113
114static struct fb_ops intelfb_ops = {
115 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
116 .fb_check_var = drm_fb_helper_check_var,
117 .fb_set_par = intel_fbdev_set_par,
118 .fb_fillrect = drm_fb_helper_cfb_fillrect,
119 .fb_copyarea = drm_fb_helper_cfb_copyarea,
120 .fb_imageblit = drm_fb_helper_cfb_imageblit,
121 .fb_pan_display = intel_fbdev_pan_display,
122 .fb_blank = intel_fbdev_blank,
123 .fb_setcmap = drm_fb_helper_setcmap,
124 .fb_debug_enter = drm_fb_helper_debug_enter,
125 .fb_debug_leave = drm_fb_helper_debug_leave,
126};
127#endif
128
129static int intelfb_alloc(struct drm_fb_helper *helper,
130 struct drm_fb_helper_surface_size *sizes)
131{
132 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev =
133 container_of(helper, struct intel_fbdev, helper);
134 struct drm_framebuffer *fb;
135 struct drm_device *dev = helper->dev;
136 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(dev);
137 static const struct drm_mode_fb_cmd2 zero_mode_cmd;
138 struct drm_mode_fb_cmd2 mode_cmd = zero_mode_cmd;
139 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = NULL;
140 int size, ret;
141
142 /* we don't do packed 24bpp */
143 if (sizes->surface_bpp == 24)
144 sizes->surface_bpp = 32;
145
146 mode_cmd.width = sizes->surface_width;
147 mode_cmd.height = sizes->surface_height;
148
149#ifdef __NetBSD__
150 mode_cmd.pitches[0] = round_up(mode_cmd.width *
151 DIV_ROUND_UP(sizes->surface_bpp, 8), 64);
152#else
153 mode_cmd.pitches[0] = ALIGN(mode_cmd.width *
154 DIV_ROUND_UP(sizes->surface_bpp, 8), 64);
155#endif
156 mode_cmd.pixel_format = drm_mode_legacy_fb_format(sizes->surface_bpp,
157 sizes->surface_depth);
158
159 size = mode_cmd.pitches[0] * mode_cmd.height;
160 size = PAGE_ALIGN(size);
161
162 /* If the FB is too big, just don't use it since fbdev is not very
163 * important and we should probably use that space with FBC or other
164 * features. */
165 if (size * 2 < dev_priv->gtt.stolen_usable_size)
166 obj = i915_gem_object_create_stolen(dev, size);
167 if (obj == NULL)
168 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, size);
169 if (!obj) {
170 DRM_ERROR("failed to allocate framebuffer\n");
171 ret = -ENOMEM;
172 goto out;
173 }
174
175 fb = __intel_framebuffer_create(dev, &mode_cmd, obj);
176 if (IS_ERR(fb)) {
177 ret = PTR_ERR(fb);
178 goto out_unref;
179 }
180
181 /* Flush everything out, we'll be doing GTT only from now on */
182 ret = intel_pin_and_fence_fb_obj(NULL, fb, NULL, NULL, NULL);
183 if (ret) {
184 DRM_ERROR("failed to pin obj: %d\n", ret);
185 goto out_fb;
186 }
187
188 ifbdev->fb = to_intel_framebuffer(fb);
189
190 return 0;
191
192out_fb:
193 drm_framebuffer_remove(fb);
194out_unref:
195 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
196out:
197 return ret;
198}
199
200static int intelfb_create(struct drm_fb_helper *helper,
201 struct drm_fb_helper_surface_size *sizes)
202{
203 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev =
204 container_of(helper, struct intel_fbdev, helper);
205 struct intel_framebuffer *intel_fb = ifbdev->fb;
206 struct drm_device *dev = helper->dev;
207 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
208#ifndef __NetBSD__
209 struct fb_info *info;
210#endif
211 struct drm_framebuffer *fb;
212 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
213 int size, ret;
214 bool prealloc = false;
215
216 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
217 if (intel_fb &&
218 (sizes->fb_width > intel_fb->base.width ||
219 sizes->fb_height > intel_fb->base.height)) {
220 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("BIOS fb too small (%dx%d), we require (%dx%d),"
221 " releasing it\n",
222 intel_fb->base.width, intel_fb->base.height,
223 sizes->fb_width, sizes->fb_height);
224 drm_framebuffer_unreference(&intel_fb->base);
225 intel_fb = ifbdev->fb = NULL;
226 }
227 if (!intel_fb || WARN_ON(!intel_fb->obj)) {
228 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no BIOS fb, allocating a new one\n");
229 ret = intelfb_alloc(helper, sizes);
230 if (ret)
231 goto out_unlock;
232 intel_fb = ifbdev->fb;
233 } else {
234 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("re-using BIOS fb\n");
235 prealloc = true;
236 sizes->fb_width = intel_fb->base.width;
237 sizes->fb_height = intel_fb->base.height;
238 }
239
240 obj = intel_fb->obj;
241 size = obj->base.size;
242
243#ifdef __NetBSD__
244 {
245 static const struct intelfb_attach_args zero_ifa;
246 struct intelfb_attach_args ifa = zero_ifa;
247
248 ifa.ifa_drm_dev = dev;
249 ifa.ifa_fb_helper = helper;
250 ifa.ifa_fb_sizes = *sizes;
251 ifa.ifa_fb_bst = dev->pdev->pd_pa.pa_memt;
252 ifa.ifa_fb_addr = (dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base +
253 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj));
254 ifa.ifa_fb_size = size;
255 ifa.ifa_fb_zero = (ifbdev->fb->obj->stolen && !prealloc);
256
257 /*
258 * XXX Should do this asynchronously, since we hold
259 * dev->struct_mutex.
260 */
261 helper->fbdev = config_found_ia(dev->dev, "intelfbbus", &ifa, NULL);
262 if (helper->fbdev == NULL) {
263 DRM_ERROR("unable to attach intelfb\n");
264 ret = -ENXIO;
265 goto out_unpin;
266 }
267 fb = &ifbdev->fb->base;
268 ifbdev->helper.fb = fb;
269 }
270#else
271 info = drm_fb_helper_alloc_fbi(helper);
272 if (IS_ERR(info)) {
273 ret = PTR_ERR(info);
274 goto out_unpin;
275 }
276
277 info->par = helper;
278
279 fb = &ifbdev->fb->base;
280
281 ifbdev->helper.fb = fb;
282
283 strcpy(info->fix.id, "inteldrmfb");
284
285 info->flags = FBINFO_DEFAULT | FBINFO_CAN_FORCE_OUTPUT;
286 info->fbops = &intelfb_ops;
287
288 /* setup aperture base/size for vesafb takeover */
289 info->apertures->ranges[0].base = dev->mode_config.fb_base;
290 info->apertures->ranges[0].size = dev_priv->gtt.mappable_end;
291
292 info->fix.smem_start = dev->mode_config.fb_base + i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj);
293 info->fix.smem_len = size;
294
295 info->screen_base =
296 ioremap_wc(dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base + i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj),
297 size);
298 if (!info->screen_base) {
299 ret = -ENOSPC;
300 goto out_destroy_fbi;
301 }
302 info->screen_size = size;
303
304 /* This driver doesn't need a VT switch to restore the mode on resume */
305 info->skip_vt_switch = true;
306
307 drm_fb_helper_fill_fix(info, fb->pitches[0], fb->depth);
308 drm_fb_helper_fill_var(info, &ifbdev->helper, sizes->fb_width, sizes->fb_height);
309
310 /* If the object is shmemfs backed, it will have given us zeroed pages.
311 * If the object is stolen however, it will be full of whatever
312 * garbage was left in there.
313 */
314 if (ifbdev->fb->obj->stolen && !prealloc)
315 memset_io(info->screen_base, 0, info->screen_size);
316#endif
317
318 /* Use default scratch pixmap (info->pixmap.flags = FB_PIXMAP_SYSTEM) */
319
320 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("allocated %dx%d fb: 0x%08"PRIx64", bo %p\n",
321 fb->width, fb->height,
322 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj), obj);
323
324 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
325#ifndef __NetBSD__
326 vga_switcheroo_client_fb_set(dev->pdev, info);
327#endif
328 return 0;
329
330#ifndef __NetBSD__
331out_destroy_fbi:
332 drm_fb_helper_release_fbi(helper);
333#endif
334out_unpin:
335 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(obj);
336 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
337out_unlock:
338 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
339 return ret;
340}
341
342/** Sets the color ramps on behalf of RandR */
343static void intel_crtc_fb_gamma_set(struct drm_crtc *crtc, u16 red, u16 green,
344 u16 blue, int regno)
345{
346 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
347
348 intel_crtc->lut_r[regno] = red >> 8;
349 intel_crtc->lut_g[regno] = green >> 8;
350 intel_crtc->lut_b[regno] = blue >> 8;
351}
352
353static void intel_crtc_fb_gamma_get(struct drm_crtc *crtc, u16 *red, u16 *green,
354 u16 *blue, int regno)
355{
356 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
357
358 *red = intel_crtc->lut_r[regno] << 8;
359 *green = intel_crtc->lut_g[regno] << 8;
360 *blue = intel_crtc->lut_b[regno] << 8;
361}
362
363static struct drm_fb_helper_crtc *
364intel_fb_helper_crtc(struct drm_fb_helper *fb_helper, struct drm_crtc *crtc)
365{
366 int i;
367
368 for (i = 0; i < fb_helper->crtc_count; i++)
369 if (fb_helper->crtc_info[i].mode_set.crtc == crtc)
370 return &fb_helper->crtc_info[i];
371
372 return NULL;
373}
374
375/*
376 * Try to read the BIOS display configuration and use it for the initial
377 * fb configuration.
378 *
379 * The BIOS or boot loader will generally create an initial display
380 * configuration for us that includes some set of active pipes and displays.
381 * This routine tries to figure out which pipes and connectors are active
382 * and stuffs them into the crtcs and modes array given to us by the
383 * drm_fb_helper code.
384 *
385 * The overall sequence is:
386 * intel_fbdev_init - from driver load
387 * intel_fbdev_init_bios - initialize the intel_fbdev using BIOS data
388 * drm_fb_helper_init - build fb helper structs
389 * drm_fb_helper_single_add_all_connectors - more fb helper structs
390 * intel_fbdev_initial_config - apply the config
391 * drm_fb_helper_initial_config - call ->probe then register_framebuffer()
392 * drm_setup_crtcs - build crtc config for fbdev
393 * intel_fb_initial_config - find active connectors etc
394 * drm_fb_helper_single_fb_probe - set up fbdev
395 * intelfb_create - re-use or alloc fb, build out fbdev structs
396 *
397 * Note that we don't make special consideration whether we could actually
398 * switch to the selected modes without a full modeset. E.g. when the display
399 * is in VGA mode we need to recalculate watermarks and set a new high-res
400 * framebuffer anyway.
401 */
402static bool intel_fb_initial_config(struct drm_fb_helper *fb_helper,
403 struct drm_fb_helper_crtc **crtcs,
404 struct drm_display_mode **modes,
405 struct drm_fb_offset *offsets,
406 bool *enabled, int width, int height)
407{
408 struct drm_device *dev = fb_helper->dev;
409 int i, j;
410 bool *save_enabled;
411 bool fallback = true;
412 int num_connectors_enabled = 0;
413 int num_connectors_detected = 0;
414 uint64_t conn_configured = 0, mask;
415 int pass = 0;
416
417 save_enabled = kcalloc(fb_helper->connector_count, sizeof(bool),
418 GFP_KERNEL);
419 if (!save_enabled)
420 return false;
421
422 memcpy(save_enabled, enabled, fb_helper->connector_count);
423 mask = (1 << fb_helper->connector_count) - 1;
424retry:
425 for (i = 0; i < fb_helper->connector_count; i++) {
426 struct drm_fb_helper_connector *fb_conn;
427 struct drm_connector *connector;
428 struct drm_encoder *encoder;
429 struct drm_fb_helper_crtc *new_crtc;
430
431 fb_conn = fb_helper->connector_info[i];
432 connector = fb_conn->connector;
433
434 if (conn_configured & (1 << i))
435 continue;
436
437 if (pass == 0 && !connector->has_tile)
438 continue;
439
440 if (connector->status == connector_status_connected)
441 num_connectors_detected++;
442
443 if (!enabled[i]) {
444 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("connector %s not enabled, skipping\n",
445 connector->name);
446 conn_configured |= (1 << i);
447 continue;
448 }
449
450 if (connector->force == DRM_FORCE_OFF) {
451 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("connector %s is disabled by user, skipping\n",
452 connector->name);
453 enabled[i] = false;
454 continue;
455 }
456
457 encoder = connector->encoder;
458 if (!encoder || WARN_ON(!encoder->crtc)) {
459 if (connector->force > DRM_FORCE_OFF)
460 goto bail;
461
462 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("connector %s has no encoder or crtc, skipping\n",
463 connector->name);
464 enabled[i] = false;
465 conn_configured |= (1 << i);
466 continue;
467 }
468
469 num_connectors_enabled++;
470
471 new_crtc = intel_fb_helper_crtc(fb_helper, encoder->crtc);
472
473 /*
474 * Make sure we're not trying to drive multiple connectors
475 * with a single CRTC, since our cloning support may not
476 * match the BIOS.
477 */
478 for (j = 0; j < fb_helper->connector_count; j++) {
479 if (crtcs[j] == new_crtc) {
480 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("fallback: cloned configuration\n");
481 goto bail;
482 }
483 }
484
485 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("looking for cmdline mode on connector %s\n",
486 connector->name);
487
488 /* go for command line mode first */
489 modes[i] = drm_pick_cmdline_mode(fb_conn, width, height);
490
491 /* try for preferred next */
492 if (!modes[i]) {
493 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("looking for preferred mode on connector %s %d\n",
494 connector->name, connector->has_tile);
495 modes[i] = drm_has_preferred_mode(fb_conn, width,
496 height);
497 }
498
499 /* No preferred mode marked by the EDID? Are there any modes? */
500 if (!modes[i] && !list_empty(&connector->modes)) {
501 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("using first mode listed on connector %s\n",
502 connector->name);
503 modes[i] = list_first_entry(&connector->modes,
504 struct drm_display_mode,
505 head);
506 }
507
508 /* last resort: use current mode */
509 if (!modes[i]) {
510 /*
511 * IMPORTANT: We want to use the adjusted mode (i.e.
512 * after the panel fitter upscaling) as the initial
513 * config, not the input mode, which is what crtc->mode
514 * usually contains. But since our current
515 * code puts a mode derived from the post-pfit timings
516 * into crtc->mode this works out correctly.
517 */
518 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("looking for current mode on connector %s\n",
519 connector->name);
520 modes[i] = &encoder->crtc->mode;
521 }
522 crtcs[i] = new_crtc;
523
524 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("connector %s on pipe %c [CRTC:%d]: %dx%d%s\n",
525 connector->name,
526 pipe_name(to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc)->pipe),
527 encoder->crtc->base.id,
528 modes[i]->hdisplay, modes[i]->vdisplay,
529 modes[i]->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE ? "i" :"");
530
531 fallback = false;
532 conn_configured |= (1 << i);
533 }
534
535 if ((conn_configured & mask) != mask) {
536 pass++;
537 goto retry;
538 }
539
540 /*
541 * If the BIOS didn't enable everything it could, fall back to have the
542 * same user experiencing of lighting up as much as possible like the
543 * fbdev helper library.
544 */
545 if (num_connectors_enabled != num_connectors_detected &&
546 num_connectors_enabled < INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes) {
547 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("fallback: Not all outputs enabled\n");
548 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Enabled: %i, detected: %i\n", num_connectors_enabled,
549 num_connectors_detected);
550 fallback = true;
551 }
552
553 if (fallback) {
554bail:
555 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Not using firmware configuration\n");
556 memcpy(enabled, save_enabled, fb_helper->connector_count);
557 kfree(save_enabled);
558 return false;
559 }
560
561 kfree(save_enabled);
562 return true;
563}
564
565static const struct drm_fb_helper_funcs intel_fb_helper_funcs = {
566 .initial_config = intel_fb_initial_config,
567 .gamma_set = intel_crtc_fb_gamma_set,
568 .gamma_get = intel_crtc_fb_gamma_get,
569 .fb_probe = intelfb_create,
570};
571
572static void intel_fbdev_destroy(struct drm_device *dev,
573 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev)
574{
575#ifdef __NetBSD__
576 int ret;
577#endif
578
579#ifdef __NetBSD__
580 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
581 ret = -config_detach(ifbdev->helper.fbdev, DETACH_FORCE);
582 if (ret)
583 DRM_ERROR("failed to detach intelfb: %d\n", ret);
584 ifbdev->helper.fbdev = NULL;
585#else
586 drm_fb_helper_unregister_fbi(&ifbdev->helper);
587 drm_fb_helper_release_fbi(&ifbdev->helper);
588#endif
589
590 drm_fb_helper_fini(&ifbdev->helper);
591
592 drm_framebuffer_unregister_private(&ifbdev->fb->base);
593 drm_framebuffer_remove(&ifbdev->fb->base);
594}
595
596/*
597 * Build an intel_fbdev struct using a BIOS allocated framebuffer, if possible.
598 * The core display code will have read out the current plane configuration,
599 * so we use that to figure out if there's an object for us to use as the
600 * fb, and if so, we re-use it for the fbdev configuration.
601 *
602 * Note we only support a single fb shared across pipes for boot (mostly for
603 * fbcon), so we just find the biggest and use that.
604 */
605static bool intel_fbdev_init_bios(struct drm_device *dev,
606 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev)
607{
608 struct intel_framebuffer *fb = NULL;
609 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
610 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc;
611 unsigned int max_size = 0;
612
613 /* Find the largest fb */
614 for_each_crtc(dev, crtc) {
615 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj =
616 intel_fb_obj(crtc->primary->state->fb);
617 intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
618
619 if (!crtc->state->active || !obj) {
620 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pipe %c not active or no fb, skipping\n",
621 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
622 continue;
623 }
624
625 if (obj->base.size > max_size) {
626 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("found possible fb from plane %c\n",
627 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
628 fb = to_intel_framebuffer(crtc->primary->state->fb);
629 max_size = obj->base.size;
630 }
631 }
632
633 if (!fb) {
634 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no active fbs found, not using BIOS config\n");
635 goto out;
636 }
637
638 /* Now make sure all the pipes will fit into it */
639 for_each_crtc(dev, crtc) {
640 unsigned int cur_size;
641
642 intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
643
644 if (!crtc->state->active) {
645 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pipe %c not active, skipping\n",
646 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
647 continue;
648 }
649
650 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("checking plane %c for BIOS fb\n",
651 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
652
653 /*
654 * See if the plane fb we found above will fit on this
655 * pipe. Note we need to use the selected fb's pitch and bpp
656 * rather than the current pipe's, since they differ.
657 */
658 cur_size = intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_hdisplay;
659 cur_size = cur_size * fb->base.bits_per_pixel / 8;
660 if (fb->base.pitches[0] < cur_size) {
661 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("fb not wide enough for plane %c (%d vs %d)\n",
662 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe),
663 cur_size, fb->base.pitches[0]);
664 fb = NULL;
665 break;
666 }
667
668 cur_size = intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_vdisplay;
669 cur_size = intel_fb_align_height(dev, cur_size,
670 fb->base.pixel_format,
671 fb->base.modifier[0]);
672 cur_size *= fb->base.pitches[0];
673 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pipe %c area: %dx%d, bpp: %d, size: %d\n",
674 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe),
675 intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_hdisplay,
676 intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_vdisplay,
677 fb->base.bits_per_pixel,
678 cur_size);
679
680 if (cur_size > max_size) {
681 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("fb not big enough for plane %c (%d vs %d)\n",
682 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe),
683 cur_size, max_size);
684 fb = NULL;
685 break;
686 }
687
688 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("fb big enough for plane %c (%d >= %d)\n",
689 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe),
690 max_size, cur_size);
691 }
692
693 if (!fb) {
694 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("BIOS fb not suitable for all pipes, not using\n");
695 goto out;
696 }
697
698 ifbdev->preferred_bpp = fb->base.bits_per_pixel;
699 ifbdev->fb = fb;
700
701 drm_framebuffer_reference(&ifbdev->fb->base);
702
703 /* Final pass to check if any active pipes don't have fbs */
704 for_each_crtc(dev, crtc) {
705 intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
706
707 if (!crtc->state->active)
708 continue;
709
710 WARN(!crtc->primary->fb,
711 "re-used BIOS config but lost an fb on crtc %d\n",
712 crtc->base.id);
713 }
714
715
716 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("using BIOS fb for initial console\n");
717 return true;
718
719out:
720
721 return false;
722}
723
724static void intel_fbdev_suspend_worker(struct work_struct *work)
725{
726#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX fb suspend */
727 intel_fbdev_set_suspend(container_of(work,
728 struct drm_i915_private,
729 fbdev_suspend_work)->dev,
730 FBINFO_STATE_RUNNING,
731 true);
732#endif
733}
734
735int intel_fbdev_init(struct drm_device *dev)
736{
737 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev;
738 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
739 int ret;
740
741 if (WARN_ON(INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes == 0))
742 return -ENODEV;
743
744 ifbdev = kzalloc(sizeof(struct intel_fbdev), GFP_KERNEL);
745 if (ifbdev == NULL)
746 return -ENOMEM;
747
748 drm_fb_helper_prepare(dev, &ifbdev->helper, &intel_fb_helper_funcs);
749
750 if (!intel_fbdev_init_bios(dev, ifbdev))
751 ifbdev->preferred_bpp = 32;
752
753 ret = drm_fb_helper_init(dev, &ifbdev->helper,
754 INTEL_INFO(dev)->num_pipes, 4);
755 if (ret) {
756 kfree(ifbdev);
757 return ret;
758 }
759
760 ifbdev->helper.atomic = true;
761
762 dev_priv->fbdev = ifbdev;
763 INIT_WORK(&dev_priv->fbdev_suspend_work, intel_fbdev_suspend_worker);
764
765 drm_fb_helper_single_add_all_connectors(&ifbdev->helper);
766
767 return 0;
768}
769
770void intel_fbdev_initial_config(void *data, async_cookie_t cookie)
771{
772 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = data;
773 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev = dev_priv->fbdev;
774
775 /* Due to peculiar init order wrt to hpd handling this is separate. */
776 drm_fb_helper_initial_config(&ifbdev->helper, ifbdev->preferred_bpp);
777}
778
779void intel_fbdev_fini(struct drm_device *dev)
780{
781 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
782 if (!dev_priv->fbdev)
783 return;
784
785 flush_work(&dev_priv->fbdev_suspend_work);
786
787 async_synchronize_full();
788 intel_fbdev_destroy(dev, dev_priv->fbdev);
789 kfree(dev_priv->fbdev);
790 dev_priv->fbdev = NULL;
791}
792
793#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX fb suspend */
794void intel_fbdev_set_suspend(struct drm_device *dev, int state, bool synchronous)
795{
796 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
797 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev = dev_priv->fbdev;
798 struct fb_info *info;
799
800 if (!ifbdev)
801 return;
802
803 info = ifbdev->helper.fbdev;
804
805 if (synchronous) {
806 /* Flush any pending work to turn the console on, and then
807 * wait to turn it off. It must be synchronous as we are
808 * about to suspend or unload the driver.
809 *
810 * Note that from within the work-handler, we cannot flush
811 * ourselves, so only flush outstanding work upon suspend!
812 */
813 if (state != FBINFO_STATE_RUNNING)
814 flush_work(&dev_priv->fbdev_suspend_work);
815 console_lock();
816 } else {
817 /*
818 * The console lock can be pretty contented on resume due
819 * to all the printk activity. Try to keep it out of the hot
820 * path of resume if possible.
821 */
822 WARN_ON(state != FBINFO_STATE_RUNNING);
823 if (!console_trylock()) {
824 /* Don't block our own workqueue as this can
825 * be run in parallel with other i915.ko tasks.
826 */
827 schedule_work(&dev_priv->fbdev_suspend_work);
828 return;
829 }
830 }
831
832 /* On resume from hibernation: If the object is shmemfs backed, it has
833 * been restored from swap. If the object is stolen however, it will be
834 * full of whatever garbage was left in there.
835 */
836 if (state == FBINFO_STATE_RUNNING && ifbdev->fb->obj->stolen)
837 memset_io(info->screen_base, 0, info->screen_size);
838
839 drm_fb_helper_set_suspend(&ifbdev->helper, state);
840 console_unlock();
841}
842#endif
843
844void intel_fbdev_output_poll_changed(struct drm_device *dev)
845{
846 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
847 if (dev_priv->fbdev)
848 drm_fb_helper_hotplug_event(&dev_priv->fbdev->helper);
849}
850
851void intel_fbdev_restore_mode(struct drm_device *dev)
852{
853 int ret;
854 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
855 struct intel_fbdev *ifbdev = dev_priv->fbdev;
856 struct drm_fb_helper *fb_helper;
857
858 if (!ifbdev)
859 return;
860
861 fb_helper = &ifbdev->helper;
862
863 ret = drm_fb_helper_restore_fbdev_mode_unlocked(fb_helper);
864 if (ret) {
865 DRM_DEBUG("failed to restore crtc mode\n");
866 } else {
867 mutex_lock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
868 intel_fb_obj_invalidate(ifbdev->fb->obj, ORIGIN_GTT);
869 mutex_unlock(&fb_helper->dev->struct_mutex);
870 }
871}
